fLogViewer.summary: fLogViewer is a Windows program which allows one to visualize with color coded context, content of local text files or extracted text from different data sources provided by text-data-providers. fLogViewer version 1 was created in 2000 by Frederic Torres, written in visual basic 6. fLogViewer version 2 was created in 2008 by Frederic Torres, written in "C#". In 2019, Frederic Torres resume the maintenance and added numerous features, including the text-data-providers.
fLogViewer.text-data-providers: - Local Text file with extension .txt or .log or .csv or markdown. - Text returned from URL called with an HTTP GET, POST, PUT, DELETE. - Text based formatted table obtained running SELECT statment against a Microsoft SQL Server. - Text based formatted JSON obtained running SELECT statment against Azure Document DB. - Text based formatted table obtained running Kusto Queries against an Azure Application Insight instance. - Text based formatted table obtained running REDIS commands against REDIS database. - Text based formatted table obtained running SUMO query against a SUMO LOGIC. - Text based formatted file system table obtained running Windows file system command like 'dir'. - Text based formatted file system table obtained running Azure Storage command like 'list container' or 'list file'.
fLogViewer.how-to-use-text-data-providers: # How to use a text data provider? 1. Create a ".txt" or ".sql" file. 2. At the top of the file insert the connection string defining what is the text data provider type and how to connect to it. 3. Use the specific commands to query text data from the text-data-provider.

query-examples.HTTP:
-- QA Http: -- ^^^ Define the type of provider. Here it is just: name Http:
contentType application/json accept application/json
get http://api.zippopotam.us/us/01775
contentType multipart/form-data body { "username":"user1","password":"pwd1" } post https://www.brark.com/userSession extract $TOKEN token -- extract the token from the response and assign it to the variable $TOKEN
set $TOKEN 59fd75c74a27ad35d000478f9f5bx0 headers authorization:Bearer $TOKEN get https://www.brark.com/user/1234
contentType application/json body { "username":"user1", "title": "The Man!" } post https://www.brark.com/userSession put https://www.brark.com/userSession patch https://www.brark.com/userSession
delete https://www.brark.com/user/user1
query-examples.Microsoft-SQL-Server:
-- ConnectionString: Server=.;Database=ContosoRetailDW;Trusted_Connection=True; -- ^^^ Define the type of provider. Name Type: Keys
-- Just display a text message select 'Last 10 product updates'
-- display text of table DimProduct select top 10 * from DimProduct order by UpdateDate desc
query-examples.Azure-Document-DB:
-- fred-document-db-2 DocumentDB: https://xxxx-cosmos-2.documents.azure.com:443/ ABCDEFZTq4qAGNWEziAX4dLwwsZcjVsHKlhQZ83weHhD3CcrjQBeSYafHPh2KYmTLA== -- ^^^ Define the type of provider. Name Type: Keys
use ToDoList Items
select COUNT(c) Count FROM c SELECT * FROM c SELECT * FROM c WHERE c.id = 'Andersen.1'
-- This select show how to format the modified date of the record SELECT TimestampToDateTime(c._ts*1000) as LastModified, c as record FROM c WHERE c.TransactionId in (607600)
query-examples.REDIS:
-- QA-ENV Redis: myRedis.redis.cache.windows.net:6380 fNO0fHlTUzE= ssl=true -- ^^^ Define the type of provider. Name Type: Keys
-- Query the REDIS database for a all key starting with a 'a' keys a* get 1234
-- How to create key setString myName myValue setList fList 1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8 30 setHash fuser:999 username=martina,firstName=Martina,lastName=Elisa,country=GB 30 setString fredis_debug_mode true 60 del fList
query-examples.SUMO-LOGIC:
-- QA-ENV Sumo: Sumo ACCESS_ID ACCESS_KEY -- ^^^ Define the type of provider. Name Type: Keys
-- Max row returned by resultset limit 1000
-- List of columns to display columns _messagetime _collector _sourcecategory cs_uri_stem cs_uri_query _raw
timespan 2023-06-09 2022-06-09 -- Start/end of day timespan PT60M -- Past 60 minutes timespan PT1H -- Past 1 hour
prequery (_sourceCategory=qa-environment*) query "services.accounting"
sortbymessagetime -- sortbyreceipttime
query | count _sourceCategory | sort by _count
query-examples.Azure-Storage:
-- QA AzureStorage: AzureStorage -- ^^^ Define the type of provider. Name Type: Keys -- The Azure Storage Commands avaialable are : use, listContainer, dir path wildCard.
select '' select ' A Z U R E S T O R A G E: test0000flogviewer `txt_hdr' select ''
-- Use the command 'use' to select a storage account. use test0000flogviewer Iuerioeurwork8vdGxFz20
maxContainer 132
-- List all the containers in the storage account. listContainer
-- List the directories and files in a specific path. dir /public/projects dir /public/projects/MUSB_UsbDiskAsProgram dir /public/projects/MUSB_UsbDiskAsProgram/Debug
-- Use another storage account. use mainStorage XisndnvyvndnsiXXisndnvyvndnsiX dir /dashboard -- List the directories and files in a specific path including wild card dir /dashboard *.json

fLogViewer.rules: - If the question is not related to the fLogViewer software or the current LLM model, say "I'm sorry, I can only answer questions about the the software fLogViewer." - Use quotes from the content of the website to answer the question. - Return code sample in markdown format, do not include the xml tag, do not include the html tag. - Use paragraphs in your output.
